questions.question: What percentage of global aquaculture production does Asia account for?
Which of the following is NOT one of the main species cultured in Timor-Leste?
What are the three pillars of sustainability in aquaculture?
What does EAA stand for in the context of sustainable aquaculture?
Which of the following is NOT a key principle of the Ecosystem Approach to Aquaculture?
choices: Develop aquaculture in isolation from other sectors
Consider other sectors, policies, and goals
questions.answer: Develop aquaculture in isolation from other sectors

questions.question: What is the primary goal of environmental sustainability in aquaculture?
Which of the following is a challenge for aquaculture development in Timor-Leste?
What is the role of economic sustainability in aquaculture?
Which of the following is an aspect of social sustainability in aquaculture?
What is the primary focus of the Ecosystem Approach to Aquaculture?
choices: Integrating aquaculture within the wider ecosystem
Prioritizing economic gains over environmental concerns
questions.answer: Integrating aquaculture within the wider ecosystem

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of implementing the Ecosystem Approach to Aquaculture?
What is the purpose of carrying capacity assessment in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: To determine the maximum weight a boat can carry
To assess the environmental limits for aquaculture in an area
To calculate the number of workers needed
To measure the size of fish tanks
questions.answer: To assess the environmental limits for aquaculture in an area

questions.question: Which global organization promotes the Ecosystem Approach to Aquaculture?
What is the primary goal of sustainable aquaculture?
choices: To meet the demand for seafood while preserving ecosystems
To eliminate all forms of fishing
questions.answer: To meet the demand for seafood while preserving ecosystems

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of resource efficiency in aquaculture?
What is the role of biosecurity in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: To increase the use of antibiotics
To prevent and control disease outbreaks
To isolate aquaculture from the environment
To maximize fish density in ponds
questions.answer: To prevent and control disease outbreaks

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of integrated multi-trophic aquaculture (IMTA)?
What is the primary challenge of implementing sustainable aquaculture in developing countries?
Which of the following is an example of environmental impact assessment in aquaculture?
choices: Avoiding all interaction with the environment

questions.question: What is the purpose of adaptive management in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: To continuously adjust practices based on monitoring
questions.answer: To continuously adjust practices based on monitoring

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration in site selection for sustainable aquaculture?
What role does stakeholder participation play in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: It is unnecessary and should be avoided
It ensures all voices are heard in decision-making
It slows down development and should be minimized
questions.answer: It ensures all voices are heard in decision-making

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of social sustainability in aquaculture?
choices: Maximizing profits at any social cost

questions.question: What is the purpose of the precautionary approach in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: To avoid any form of aquaculture
To take preventive measures against potential harm
questions.answer: To take preventive measures against potential harm

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of sustainable aquaculture in developing countries?
What is the role of technology in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: It is irrelevant and should be avoided
It can enhance efficiency and reduce environmental impacts
It always leads to unsustainable practices
It should replace traditional knowledge entirely
questions.answer: It can enhance efficiency and reduce environmental impacts

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of economic sustainability in aquaculture?
choices: Maximizing short-term profits at any cost
Ensuring long-term profitability while respecting environmental limits
Avoiding all forms of economic analysis
questions.answer: Ensuring long-term profitability while respecting environmental limits

questions.question: What is the importance of water quality management in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: It is unnecessary and can be ignored
It only affects fish health, not the environment
It is crucial for both aquatic organism health and environmental protection
It only matters in freshwater aquaculture
questions.answer: It is crucial for both aquatic organism health and environmental protection

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential conflict between aquaculture and other coastal activities?
choices: Increased fish stocks for capture fisheries

questions.question: What is the role of policy and regulatory frameworks in sustainable aquaculture?
choices: They are unnecessary and hinder development
They provide guidelines and ensure responsible practices
They should focus solely on maximizing production
They are only relevant in developed countries
questions.answer: They provide guidelines and ensure responsible practices
